## Where we are going

## Hypothesis test for a population mean

Let $Y_1, Y_2,...$ be an iid sample from a population with mean $\mu$ and variance $\sigma^2$. We want to test

$H_0: \mu = \mu_0 \hspace{1cm} H_A: \mu \neq \mu_0$

## Hypothesis test for a population proportion

Let $Y_1, Y_2,...\overset{iid}{\sim} Bernoulli(p)$. We want to test

$H_0: p = p_0 \hspace{1cm} H_A: p \neq p_0$
